body.p: The Board noted that paragraph 30 of IFRS 5 requires an entity to ‘present and disclose information that enables users of the financial statements to evaluate the financial effects of discontinued operations and disposals of non‑current assets (or disposal groups).’ Paragraph BC17 below states that ‘the Board concluded that providing information about assets and groups of assets and liabilities to be disposed of is of benefit to users of financial statements. Such information should assist users in assessing the timing, amount and uncertainty of future cash flows.’
